intro: Limeum myosotis var. confusum, commonly known as the confused forget-me-not, is a member of the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers and heart-shaped leaves. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and is often found in alpine meadows. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
